message.content:
cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DB, cs.HC 

This paper discusses the challenges of information management and discovery on social content sites, which involves analyzing content and social data, interpreting user information needs, and presenting relevant information. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also discusses the integration of content and social information, which relates to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SOC (Social and Societal Computing). The proposed logical architecture for tackling these challenges involves managing and accessing data, which relates to cs.DB (Databases). Finally, the paper discusses the presentation of information to users, which relates to cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
